content: time you go around until you have 36 stitches left on the stockinette section the same number of stitches as you have in the top ribbed section notice please that you do not work decreases on both sides of the stockinette section every time we want this decrease to be gradual making plenty of room for the ankle so if you work a decrease on one side in one round the next round will be plain knit on that side and the decrease will be on the other side they take turns in most patterns the instructions will look something like this e work top of foot in established ribbed pattern knit stockinette or bottom of foot to last 2 stiches k2tog f work top of foot in established ribbed pattern ssk knit to end of round repeat e and f until there are 36 stitches on the bottom of the foot 72 stitches total foot work in established pattern ribbing on top stockinette on bottom until the length of the foot is about 1 5 inches shorter than desired toe the toe is worked similarly to the bottom of the foot in the gusset section for the first portion of the decreases you will alternate decrease rounds with plain knit rounds for gradual shaping the last few decrease rounds are done without any plain knit rounds many designers like to have a couple stitches in between the mirrored decreases in the toes of their socks for a pretty line in commercial patterns the directions often look like this g k1 ssk knit to 3 stitches before end of top of foot k2tog k1 repeat for bottom of foot h knit repeat g and h until there are 36 stitches total half the stitch count before starting the toe repeat g until there are 16 stitches total 8 on the top and 8 on the bottom of the foot use the kitchener stitch description graphic and demo video link below to graft the toe closed weave ends into the inside of the socks do not tie knots © 2025 kiersten harrod all rights reserved go to www kierstenj com for more resources to help you be a better knitter page 6 of 7 kitchener stitch break off working yarn with approximately 18 yarn loose thread tapestry needle arrange knitting needles so that the points point to the right the stitches are divided exactly in half between a front and back needle the working yarn is coming from the back needle and all the fabric is below the needles to begin working the kitchener stitch work only 1b and then 2b continue until there is one stitch left on each needle then work 1a and then 2a do not knot the basic pattern of the kitchener stitch is 1 a insert tapestry needle into first stitch on front knitting needle as if to knit slide off knitting needle b insert tapestry needle into next stitch as if to purl leave stitch
